title: King & King
descriptions: "King & King" is a charming fairytale about Prince Bertie, who is under pressure from his mother to get married and take over the kingdom. The Queen, tired of ruling, insists Bertie must marry a princess, but none of the candidates from around the world interest him. However, when Princess Madeleine arrives with her brother Prince Lee, Bertie and Lee fall in love at first sight. They get married, becoming King and King, and the Queen can finally retire. The book ends with a tender kiss between the two kings, and is beautifully illustrated with mixed-media art.

In "King & King," Prince Bertie is pressured by his mother, the Queen, to marry and take over her responsibilities. Despite her sending princesses from all over the world to sway him, Bertie is uninterested. It is only when he meets Prince Lee, the brother of one of the visiting princesses, that he finds love. The two princes marry, becoming King and King, and the Queen finally gets to relax. The story ends with a kiss between the two kings.

"King & King" is a fairytale about Prince Bertie, a young man who, despite his mother's insistence, has no interest in marrying a princess. His mother, the Queen, is tired of ruling and wishes to pass on the responsibility to her son, so she parades numerous princesses from around the world in front of him. None of them succeed in catching his interest, though his page falls in love with a princess from Greenland. When Princess Madeleine and her brother, Prince Lee, arrive, both Bertie and Lee instantly fall in love and immediately begin planning their wedding. The two princes are declared King and King, and the Queen can finally relax. The book ends with a kiss between the two kings.

"King & King" is a children's book that tells the story of Prince Bertie, who is expected to marry a princess and take on the responsibilities of ruling the kingdom from his mother, the Queen. Despite the Queen's efforts, Bertie is uninterested in all the princesses presented to him. However, when Princess Madeleine and her brother, Prince Lee, arrive, Bertie and Lee instantly fall in love. The two princes marry and become King and King, allowing the Queen to retire. The story ends with a kiss between the two kings, and is accompanied by vibrant, mixed-media illustrations throughout.
generation_prompt_text:
Please write a summary of the following book. A sample summary is included below for reference. Use the sample as a guideline for quality and level of detail.

---

Title: King & King

Description: "On the tallest mountain above town," the young Prince Bertie still has not married, as is the custom in his kingdom. His mother, a grouchy Queen who is tired of ruling and wishes to pass on the responsibility to her son, insists he must find a princess to marry. The prince tells his mom "Very well, Mother.... I must say, though, I've never cared much for princesses." His mother marches princess after princess through the castle, from places ranging from Greenland to Mumbai, but in spite of their various talents — Princess Aria of Austria sings opera, Princess Dolly from Texas juggles and does magic tricks — they fail to interest the prince (though the prince's page falls in love with the princess from Greenland). After a while, along comes Princess Madeleine escorted by her brother Prince Lee. At the same time, both Bertie and Lee exclaim, "What a wonderful prince!" The princes immediately fall in love, and they begin marriage preparations at once. The wedding is attended by all the rejected princesses and their families; the two princes are declared King and King, and the Queen can finally relax, sunning herself in a lounge chair near the page and the princess from Greenland. The story ends with a kiss between the two kings. The illustrations are created as collages with cut paper and mixed-media art, including ink and paint.
